snippet: Venezuela’s president, Nicolás Maduro, on Wednesday devalued the currency by 37 percent and raised fuel prices for the first time in 17 years.
abstract: Venezuelan Pres Nicolas Maduro raises fuel prices for first time in 17 years and devalues bolivar currency by 37 percent, measures designed to shore up nation's struggling finances.
lead_paragraph: Venezuela’s president, Nicolás Maduro, on Wednesday devalued the currency by 37 percent and raised fuel prices for the first time in 17 years.

headline.main: Venezuela Devalues Currency and Raises Price of Gasoline
headline.print_headline: Business Briefing; Venezuela Devalues Currency and Raises Price of Gasoline
